citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of a new coccoid mehanogen, Methanogenium tatii sp. nov. from a solfataric field on mount Tatio.

p.s: Description of Methanogenium tatii sp. nov.
Methanogenium tatii (ta'.ti.i. L. gen. n. tatii of the Tatio, the place of its ecological niche.
Species: Methanogenium tatii spec. nov., Zabel and Winter
Morphology: Regular or highly irregular cells, depending on the salt concentration in the medium.
Average size 3 μm in diameter, peritrichous flagellated.
Cells are Gram negative and the cell envelope is composed of hexagonal protein subunits, which seem to contain a glycoprotein of MWapp. = 120,000.
DNA base composition: 54 mol% G + C.
Growth and methane production on H2:CO2 and formate. 0.5% yeast extract, 0.5% peptone and acetate are required for optimal growth.
Yeast extract and peptone can partially be replaced by a heavy metal solution.
Found in solfataric pools at an altitude of 4750 m.
